attributes.comment:
My husband and I are in the process of adopting a child from another country, I
am concerned with the proposed fee increases for filing forms necessary to
complete our adoption. While I understand fees must be increased from time to
time, some of the increases are astronomical. For example, the fee for filing Form
N-600 (Application for Certificate of Citizenship) is proposed to increase by
EIGHTY PERCENT. The fee for Form N-565, used to formally change an adopted
child's name, is proposed to increase by over SEVENTY-TWO PERCENT. I
believe the fee hike for these two particular forms should be lowered to a more
reasonable 20%, which is in line with the proposed fee increases for other related
forms. Lastly, I would like to strongly suggest that increased fees be used to
increase USCIS staff, so that international adoptions may be processed more
quickly and efficiently. Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jennifer Goldberg
